org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon

Class DefaultBusyIcon

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon.AbstractBusyIcon
        • org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon.DecoratorBusyIcon
          • org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon.DefaultBusyIcon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Icon, BusyIcon

    public class DefaultBusyIcon
extends DecoratorBusyIcon
    Default BusyIcon implementation that paint an icon and draw on overlay a small progress bar.

    Some methods can be used for customize the LaF of this icon:

    • setBackgroundPainter(org.jdesktop.swingx.painter.Painter) and setBackgroundColor(java.awt.Color) : The background of this icon
    • setBackgroundPainted(boolean) : true for paint the background, false for no background
    • DecoratorBusyIcon.setDecoratedIcon(Icon) : Define the basic icon to draw
    • setProgressBarBounds(java.awt.Rectangle) : Define the location of the progress bar inside this icon
    • setProgressBarBackground(java.awt.Paint) and setProgressBarForeground(java.awt.Paint) : Define colors of the progress bar
    Theses methods defines some customization of the LaF's icon. Because some of theses define or depends of some locations or size parameters, they should be set at initialization time and not be updated elsewhere.

    A default LaF is installed when no customization is set.
    Theses defaults parameters can be overrided by subclasses for provide new oness:

    • installDefaultBackgroundPainter(java.awt.Color): Install the default background painter
    • installDefaultProgressBarBounds() : Install the default location and size of the progress bar
    • installDefaultProgressBarColors() : Install default colors of the progress bar

    If you need to change in a more depth the painting process, you can as the last step, to override our delegates paint's methods:

    • paintBackground(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics) : Paint the background
    • DecoratorBusyIcon.paintDecoratedIcon(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int) : Paint the basic icon
    • paintProgressBar(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, java.awt.Rectangle, boolean) : Paint the empty progress bar
    • paintProgressBarAdvance(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, java.awt.Rectangle, boolean, float, float) : Paint the progress bar advance
    Since:
    1.1
    Author:
    André Sébastien (divxdede)

      • paintUndeterminate

        protected final void paintUndeterminate(Component c,
                      Graphics g,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int frame)
        Implement undeterminate rendering by drawing a cyclic move of the progress bar advance.
        This method is marked final and can't be overrided.
        If you want customize the painting process, you should override theses methods:
        • paintBackground(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics)
        • DecoratorBusyIcon.paintDecoratedIcon(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int)
        • paintProgressBar(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, java.awt.Rectangle, boolean)
        • paintProgressBarAdvance(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, java.awt.Rectangle, boolean, float, float)

        Specified by:
        paintUndeterminate in class AbstractBusyIcon
        Parameters:
        c - Component to paint on
        g - Graphics to paint on
        x - horizontal location to start painting this icon
        y - vertical location to start painting this icon
        frame - frame number to paint (cyclic undeterminate painting)

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(Color color)
        Define the new background Painter creating the default painter with the specified color.
        This method replace the previous Background Painter that can be set with the setBackgroundPainter(org.jdesktop.swingx.painter.Painter).
        See installDefaultBackgroundPainter(java.awt.Color) method for see how this background will be render.
        Parameters:
        color - Color to use (can't be null

        This painter may be null, that means no background will be painted.

      • installDefaultBackgroundPainter

        protected void installDefaultBackgroundPainter(Color color)
        Install a default background painter used when no painter was specified or when a simple color was specified.
        This implementation create a rounded square with a vertical gradient (shading from a brighted color to the specified color)

        Subclasses can override this method for provide an other default background.

      • installDefaultProgressBarColors

        protected void installDefaultProgressBarColors()
        Install default colors for the progress bar.
        Theses colors are retrivied from the default UI using the UIManager:
        • The property ProgressBar.background for the background color
        • The property ProgressBar.foreground for the foreground color

      • installDefaultProgressBarBounds

        protected void installDefaultProgressBarBounds()
        Install default bound's location of the progress bar inside this icon.
        This implementaiton locate the progress bar at the bottom of the icon
        • Progress bar width = 80% of this icon
        • Progress bar height = 12% of this icon
        • Progress bar location = Horizontally centered, Vertically the upper-left corner is locate at 75% of this icon

      • paintProgressBarAdvance

        protected void paintProgressBarAdvance(Component c,
                           Graphics g,
                           Rectangle bounds,
                           boolean determinate,
                           float start,
                           float end)
        Paint the progress bar advance of this icon.
        Parameters:
        c - Component to paint on
        g - Graphics to paint on
        bounds - Progress bar bounds location inside this icon
        determinate - Indicate if the progress bar is in a determinate state or not
        start - Start of the advance in a ratio (0f = at the start of the progress bar, 0.5f = at the midle of the progress bar, 1.0f = at the end of the progress bar)
        end - End of the advance in a ratio (0f = at the start of the progress bar, 0.5f = at the midle of the progress bar, 1.0f = at the end of the progress bar)

      • getSignificantRatioOffset

        protected float getSignificantRatioOffset()
        Description copied from class: AbstractBusyIcon
        Return the minimum advance to reach by the BoundedRangeModel between two paint's requests in order to discard the current buffer image (cache) and update this icon with the current state.

        The BoundedRangeModel can have a large length between it's minimum and maximum values. When this length is large, this icon may receive a lot of repaint's events.
        All of theses event's should not be forwarded if theses event's don't perform a significant difference into this icon.

        By exemple, a progress bar of 50 pixels should serve a repaint event if some pixels changes. The significant ratio offset should be 1/50 = 0.02f
        In this case, this icon will be updated each time at least a pixel change inside the progress bar.

        If you render a progress bar with a radial representation, typically you can return a significant ratio offset of 1/360.
        In this case, this icon will be updated each time at least a degree change inside the radial representation.

        This information are used only in conjunction of the buffer image provided with AbstractBusyIcon.useCache() and AbstractBusyIcon.setUseCache(boolean) methods.
        If the image cache is disabled, all repaint events notified by the BoundedRangeModel will be forwarded.

        Specified by:
        getSignificantRatioOffset in class AbstractBusyIcon
        Returns:
        Minimum ratio offset that must be reach by the BoundedRangeModel between to paint processes. Can be set to 0 for serve all paint's requests
        See Also:
        AbstractBusyIcon.useCache(), AbstractBusyIcon.setUseCache(boolean), AbstractBusyIcon.getRatio()
